data.meta_description: Nelvana Enterprises, Inc. (previously known as Nelvana Limited, sometimes known as Nelvana Animation, stylized as nelvana) is a Canadian animation studio owned by Corus Entertainment. Founded in 1971, it was named by founders Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert and Clive A. Smith after a Canadian comic book superheroine created by Adrian Dingle in the 1940s.
data.text:
Nelvana

Canada's answer to SPA.

Nelvana Enterprises, Inc. (previously known as Nelvana Limited, sometimes known as Nelvana Animation, stylized as nelvana) is a Canadian animation studio owned by Corus Entertainment. Founded in 1971, it was named by founders Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert and Clive A. Smith after a Canadian comic book superheroine created by Adrian Dingle in the 1940s.

The company's production logo is a polar bear looking at the North Star, although a design featuring multiple stars was in use from 1985 to 2004.

Most of their films, shows and specials are based on licensed properties, mainly children's literature but also comic books and novels, however original programming is also part of its roster. (Literature adaptations are a common pattern in the company's content library, see List of Nelvana programs down below.) It ventured into the world of live action from its establishment in 1971 and continues to do so.

Why They Introduce the Birth of Canadian Cartoons

Canadian animation in its purest form. Speaking of which, it was the very first major Canadian cartoon company, where they are known for revolutionizing Canadian animation. However, it was the Canadian counterpart to Disney (along with Pixar and 20th Century Fox), Universal, Warner Bros. and Hanna-Barbera cartoon companies.

They distribute great Nickelodeon original animated shows such as Taina, The Fairly OddParents (Seasons 1-5) and The Backyardigans

The humor in their shows is usually very well done, and could get some laughs out of a lot.

They've also made great TV commercials.

Great voice acting in all their shows.

Their iconic polar bear logo is nothing short of heartwarming, which debuted in 1978's Halloween-themed TV special The Devil and Denial Mouse.

Canadian animation in its purest form. Speaking of which, it was the very first major Canadian cartoon company.To help make the studio even BIGGER, it sucessfully created seven primetime television specials, which are aired on CBC, from 1975 to 1980.

Christmas Two Step (1975)

A Cosmic Christmas (1977)

The Devil and Daniel Mouse (1978)

Romie-0 and Julie-8 (1979)

Intergalactic Thanksgiving (1979)

The Jack Rabbit Story (1980)

Take Me Up to the Ball Game (1980)

The popularity of the Nelvana studio, was one of the most natural icons in Canada.

Its productions feature great 2D and 3D animation.

The humor in the Canadian cartoons are really good and funny.

They've also made great TV commercials.

Its iconic polar bear logo was pure heartwarming.

Great Canadian animation.

They are known for revolutionizing the Canadian animation.

Their movies also serve nice messages.

Lovable characters.

Their adult cartoons are so good either, starting with the episode of Tales from the Crypt, "The Third Pig".

It also created beloved direct-to-video series.

Their logos are very passable. The 1985, 1995, 1999, 2004 and 2016 logos are all memorable.

They even made shows for other companies such as FOX, who did a co-production for the series Eek! the Cat and The Terrible Thunderlizards.

The American company, Disney, distributed the USA rights to CGI-animated series, Rolie Polie Olie which is a French-Canada co-production.

Their adult cartoons are good too, starting with Tales from the Crypt: The Third Pig, Clone High, Bob and Margaret, and Committed.

They produced a lot of great shows, such as:

The Adventures of Tintin

Bad Qualities

While Nelvana is so good, Nelvana was also a bad anime dubbing company, making poorly-made dubs for children's anime shows, including Cardcaptor Sakura.

Aside from the Anime, Some of their shows are bad or mediocre, such as:

Thomas and Friends: All Engines Go! (Nelvana's worst cartoon)

Ollie's Pack

The Day My Butt Went Psycho!

Wayside

Family Dog

Little Charmers

Mysticons

Oh No! It's an Alien Invasion

Scaredy Squirrel

Donkey Kong Country

Max & Ruby (Seasons 6 & 7)

Sidekick

The ZhuZhus
